definition: Aisin Gioro, family name of the Manchu emperors of the Qing dynasty
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
a nap/a sleep/CL:場|场[chang2]
to feel/to find that/thinking/awake/aware
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo

sentences.english: There are reported descendents of Aisin Gioro present in China today.
sentences.chinese: 据报道目前爱新觉罗家在中国还有后裔。

sentences.english: Aisin Gioro descendents now are from other branches of the family.
sentences.chinese: 爱新觉罗家现存后裔都是旁支。

sentences.english: The last Imperial family was the Qing Imperial family Aisin Gioro and the last Chinese Emperor was Puyi.
sentences.chinese: 最后的皇室是清皇试冬爱新觉罗荚冬溥仪是末代天子。

definition: posthumous title of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤 (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
Grand Prince (Qing title)
Manchu ethnic group of Liaoning province
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Great Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Manchuria
Kangxi, title of the reign (1661-1722) of the Kangxi Emperor 聖祖|圣祖[Sheng4 zu3]
emperor/CL:個|个[ge4]
Yongzheng, reign name of Qing emperor (1722-1735)

posthumous title of Hung Taiji 皇太極|皇太极 (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor
Fulin Emperor Shunzhi (1638-1662), second Qing emperor, reigned 1644-1662
Manchou township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
child of a Manchu bannerman family (nobility)/(fig.) privileged brat
Qianlong Emperor (1711-1799), sixth Qing emperor, princely title 寶親王|宝亲王[Bao3 Qin1 wang2], personal name 弘曆|弘历[Hong2 li4], reigned 1735-1799
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
